definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to weave/to knit/to plait/to braid/(fig.) to create (sth abstract, e.g. a dream, a lie etc)

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1

definition: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, OECD/abbr. for 經濟合作與發展組織|经济合作与发展组织

sentences.english: So she decided to knit a woolen sweater for the man.
sentences.chinese: 于是她决定为那个男人织一件羊毛衣。

sentences.english: Mark weaving Chapter applies to clothing, handbags and so on.
sentences.chinese: 织唛章适用于服装，皮包等。

sentences.english: It gives the most beautiful maple woven Dahongpao.
sentences.chinese: 它给枫树织的红袍最漂亮。

sentences.english: Convince the Songweaver to join you.
Blanket woven, went to learn Ed.
sentences.chinese: 毛毯织不齐，就去学编席。

sentences.english: A gown made of the finest wool.
sentences.chinese: 用最细的羊毛织一条长袍。

sentences.english: Dai clothes are generally made of cloth woven by the local women.
sentences.chinese: 傣族人的服装一般都是用妇女自己织的布做成的。

sentences.english: Knit, the women beat the umbrella son stroll rain in.
sentences.chinese: 织，仕女打着伞儿漫步雨中。

sentences.english: She's knitting her husband a pair of socks.
Mother often knits while watching TV.
sentences.chinese: 母亲看电视时常织东西。

sentences.english: Woven pink Whale label at bottom placket.
sentences.chinese: 织在底部门襟粉红鲸鱼标签。

sentences.english: To make a doily or lace, you use thin thread and a small hook.
sentences.chinese: 为了织一盘垫或花边，您可以使用超薄串和一个小钩。

sentences.english: Wu Min pulled his sweater and knitted his scarf.
sentences.chinese: 吴敏拆了毛衣自己织围巾。

definition: to weave/to knit/to plait/to braid/(fig.) to create (sth abstract, e.g. a dream, a lie etc)
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
Jacquard weave (machine weaving leaving protruding pattern)
